gsml:LithostratigraphicUnit.gml:description: Lower basalt, basaltic andesite and sedimentary rocks, including arkose sandstone and conglomerate (Middle Tertiary)
gsml:LithostratigraphicUnit.gml:name: Tbs
urn:cgi:object:37A6CFEE-A694-49ED-9C79-349DEE26E01F

gsml:LithostratigraphicUnit.gml:description: Sedimentary rocks related to Tertiaty volcanism; locally includes breccia, tuff and other volcanic rocks (Middle Tertiary)
gsml:LithostratigraphicUnit.gml:name: Tsv
urn:cgi:object:FCFE83A2-7012-4D42-9A3A-1569AD9F2BD7

gsml:LithodemicUnit.gml:description: Metasedimentary rocks, including schist, phyllite, quartzite and rare thin marble (Early Proterozoic)
gsml:LithodemicUnit.gml:name: Xms
urn:cgi:object:9ADCC161-B50C-4786-AFC8-4DE370EBA254

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Environment where detrital material is deposited by a stream, river, or other flow of running water, as a sorted or semi-sorted sediment in the bed of the stream or on its flood plain or delta, or as a fan at the base of a hillslope (modified from Glossary of Geology definition of alluvium; Jackson, 1997, p. 17). SLTT defines alluvial setting to describe a setting in which sediments accumulate by fluvial processes.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Alluvial setting
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Alluvial setting

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Prevailing over all other constituents
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Dominant
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Dominant

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Location on the steeper part of a hill between its summit and the drainage line, valley flat, or depression floor at the base of the hill. (Hawley, J.W., and Parsons, R.B. 1980. Glossary of selected geomorphic and geologic terms. Mimeo. USDA Soil Conservation Service, West National Technical Center, Portland, OR. 30 p.) Environments associated with mountain slopes and hill slopes, as well as base-of-slope areas influenced by hillslope processes. Hillslope activities include creep, sliding, slumping, falling, and other downslope movements caused by slope collapse induced by gravitational influence on earth materials..
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Hillslope setting
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Hillslope setting

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Existing, being in view
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Present
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Present

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Formation by crystallization of magma on the surface of the Earth..
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Extrusive igneous genesis
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Extrusive igneous genesis

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Comparatively unimportant in importance, size, or degree
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Minor
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Minor

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous environment close to the Earths surface, characterized by more rapid cooling than plutonic setting, and commonly by evidence for venting of magma body to surface as volcanic feeders..
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: hypabyssal
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: hypabyssal

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description:
Placed in or occupying a loew class, rank, or position.
Inferior.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Subordinate
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Subordinate

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Denotes that rock has original rock formation by sedimentary genesis, followed by metamorphism.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Metasedimentary genesis
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Metasedimentary genesis

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Seldom occurring or found
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Rare
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Rare

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Clastic sediment consisting of 30 percent or more clasts that are 2 mm or more in diameter. Denotes that composition of clasts is not specified.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Gravel (Gravelly sediment)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Gravel (Gravelly sediment)

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: A term for sediment having greater than 30 percent gravel-size particles (greater than 2.0 mm) (extrapolated from Folk, 1954, Figure 1a). Composition and origin of material not specified.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Generic gravelly sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Generic gravelly sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Generic gravel (sensu stricto) in which greater than half of the gravel-size fraction is in the boulder size range (greater than 256 mm)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Generic bouldery gravel
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Generic bouldery gravel

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Basaltic rock with lithologic properties that demonstrate its origin in a lava flow (e.g. vesicles, fragmentation, oxidation...)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Basaltic lava
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Basaltic lava

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Generic tuff in which more than 75 percent of the rock (volumetrically) is composed of pyroclasts less than 2 mm in diameter (diameter of volume equivalent sphere).
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Ash tuff
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Ash tuff

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock in which less than 30 percent of particles are greater than 2 mm in diameter (gravel) and sand to mud ratio is at least 1. Epiclastic, chemical, or biogenic origin of clasts not specified, composition of clasts not specified.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Generic sandstone (sandy rock of SLTTs)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Generic sandstone (sandy rock of SLTTs)

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: A volcanic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q/(Q+A+P) between 20 and 60 and P/(P+A) greater than 65... A fine-grained extrusive rock with the same general composition as andesite but having a less calcic plagioclase and more quartz; the extrusive equivalent of granodiorite. Classification based on total modal mineralogy, denotes more quantitative determination of mineralogy (e.g. thin section study)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Dacite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Dacite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Basalt that exhibits properties demonstrating volcanic origin
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Basalt lava
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Basalt lava

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: A glass-rich pyroclastic rock that has been indurated by the welding together of its glass shards under the combined action of the heat retained by particles, the weight of the overlying material, and hot gasses.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Welded tuff
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Welded tuff

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Coarse-grained pyroclastic rock in which ratio of rounded pyroclasts/angular pyroclasts less than 1.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Pyroclastic breccia
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Pyroclastic breccia

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Schistose mylonite for which the sum of modal quartz + feldspar + mica + aluminous mineral is greater than or equal to 70 percent
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Quartz feldspar pelitic schistose mylonite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Quartz feldspar pelitic schistose mylonite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Foliated metamorphic rock consisting of greater than or equal to 40 percent dark-colored amphibole, in which more than half of the non-amphibole mineral is plagioclase, and quartz less than 5 percent.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Foliated amphibolite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Foliated amphibolite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock in which in which carbonate minerals form greater than 75 percent of rock. A metamorphic rock consisting predominantly of fine- to coarse-grained recrystallized calcite and/or dolomite. Commonly has a granoblastic, saccharoidal fabric, but fabric is not specified if this term is used.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Generic marble
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Generic marble

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: A low-grade, felsic metavolcanic rock with preserved evidence of its original rhyolitic character
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Metarhyolite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Metarhyolite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rhyolite that exhibits properties demonstrating volcanic origin
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: Rhyolite lava
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Rhyolite lava
